software.leonov.progress

Class Percentage

  • java.lang.Object
    • software.leonov.progress.Percentage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ProgressListener

    public abstract class Percentage
extends Object
implements ProgressListener
    A skeletal implementation of the ProgressListener interface which calculates the progress value as a percentage of the maximum value.

    Extending class need only to implement the onUpdate(String) method, which receives the formatted representation of the percent value. The format pattern can be specified using Percentage(DecimalFormat) or Percentage(Locale, String) methods. By default, the this class formats the value to the nearest whole percent without decimal places. Users of this class are guaranteed never to receive duplicate percent values and will never encounter zero as an input.

    Using this listener when the maximum value is not specified will lead to an IllegalStateException.

    For example: 

    
     ...
     final ProgressMonitor progress = new ProgressMonitor().addProgressListener(new Percentage() {

          @Override
         public void onUpdate(final String pct) {
             System.out.println("Processed " + pct + "%");
         }
     });
     ...
    Author:
    Zhenya Leonov

    • Method Detail

      • onUpdate

        public final void onUpdate(ProgressEvent event)
        Receives a progress changed event. Then formats the value as a percentage of the maximum value and invokes onUpdate(String).
        Specified by:
        onUpdate in interface ProgressListener
        Parameters:
        event - the progress change event

      • onUpdate

        public abstract void onUpdate(String pct)
        Receives the formatted percent value as a calculation of the progress against the maximum value. Users are guaranteed never to receive duplicate percent values and will never encounter zero as an input.
        Parameters:
        pct - the formatted percent value
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the maximum value is not specified
